column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I tried Campral 3 years ago and can still remember it working well at the time. However, for whatever reason, I deliberately chose to drink even though I didn't really want to. I probably wasn't ready to give up my relationship with alcohol. Afterward, I quit taking it which was probably because Campral loses its effectiveness when drinking on it. I made this mistake at the cost of much physical and emotional stress as well as more alcohol related problems mounting up over the last 3 years. For quit some time, I have been stubbornly trying to quit on my own but finally decided to go back to that prescription. It's day 5, and the drug seems to have kicked in. My mental state is like night and day, and I didn't experience any cravings yesterday. By now, I would still be fighting it tooth and nail not to drink, especially if I had to work the next day. My doctor prescribed 1 pill 3 times a day for the first week followed by 2 pills 3 times a day thereafter. He said I may or may not have to take it the rest of my life. However, given the stakes, I plan to chose the former even if I get the feeling that I don't need it anymore or experience some of the side effects that others have commented about. My doctor also prescribed Fluoxetine (Prozac)to me in the case that I don't feel better emotionally after 3 weeks of Campral; I came to the doctor feeling pretty depressed. I'm thinking I may not need the anti-depressent afterall, but that's just my case. I rate this drug with 5 stars across the board with the assumption that it continues to work it's magic. I don't plan on discontinuing due to any of the petty side effects mentioned because, for me, the side effects of drinking are much more unbearable. I also plan to take it with the 3 meals a day so that I don't make the mistake of forgetting doses which people on other review sites mention can be problematic and led to their discontinued due use due to frustration. Why didn't I begin taking this again earlier??
